data.title: Donald Trump suffers ear wound at Pennsylvania rally in probable assassination attempt, story developing
data.meta_description: You might be mistaken, this brand is a hot sauce company not stickers.
data.text:
My daughter is in a lot of art communities. This brand is very well known for being the worst type of MAGA. In fact their discord servers have bots that post info about the company whenever it's mentioned.

Here is an example. If you order to make stickers that are Democrat focused they will send them to you cut in half. They still take your money. Artists end up having to get Paypal and CCs to do a chargeback.

You might be mistaken, this brand is a hot sauce company not stickers.

Elon Musk seems very invested in this election outcome more than past. Donating millions to Trump campaign every month being reported.

Why is that the case?

Besides tax breaks what is the gain he is trying to achieve.

He's trying to further court the right wing fash crowd into his cult/X userbase since he views anyone left of that as a lost cause now that everyone sensible has turned against him.

You might be mistaken, this brand is a hot sauce company not stickers.

No they're not.

Click on the link in their bio. It's a dumb joke about their hot takes.

Sticker Mule | Custom printing that kicks ass

Thousands of people trust us to make kick ass stickers, labels, packaging & more. Free proofs, free worldwide shipping, fast turnaround & 24/7 customer support.

Or maybe not

Mule Sauce - Sweet & spicy hot sauce | Quick free shipping | Sticker Mule

Mule Sauce uses the perfect blend of the best chili peppers to create an everyday hot sauce that everyone loves. Free shipping.

Primary business seems to be stickers though

Elon Musk seems very invested in this election outcome more than past. Donating millions to Trump campaign every month being reported.

Why is that the case?

Besides tax breaks what is the gain he is trying to achieve.

Based on his Twitter posts and likes. The conservative side are basically going to give him more freedom for his companies to run with less regulations across the board. Just imagine getting rid of government agencies that are doing research on atmospheric garbage from satellite decomissions and ozone depletion. Free reign

Elon Musk seems very invested in this election outcome more than past. Donating millions to Trump campaign every month being reported.

Why is that the case?

Besides tax breaks what is the gain he is trying to achieve.

Zero regulations means he can't get in trouble for his rolling death trap cars. Plus he's a pretty obvious white supremacist and anti-trans bigot so the whole platform appeals to him.

I'm generally up for pointing out how shit cops are, but this one's not really their fault. Not really a whole hell of a lot that can be done in that situation that doesn't end with the person on the ladder shot dead.

I swear I'm not trying to be cheeky, but isn't that literally in the job description for being a LEO working a political rally? Like if you aren't ready to jump in front of a bullet what the fuck are you doing there?

I'm generally up for pointing out how shit cops are, but this one's not really their fault. Not really a whole hell of a lot that can be done in that situation that doesn't end with the person on the ladder shot dead.

The police is saying no ladder and the police is hanging and fell and broke his lwg

It was a Butler Township police officer who encountered the gunman on the roof before the shooting. The officer was looking for the suspicious person when another officer hoisted him up so he could grab the edge of the roof, local officials said.

Butler Township Manager Tom Knights said the officer lost his grip and was not retreating when he fell 8 feet (2.4 meters) to the ground.

He was literally dangling from the edge of a building and took the defensive position he needed to at that time. He couldn't hold himself up," Knights said.

The officer, who has 10 years of experience in law enforcement, severely injured an ankle in the fall and was in a walking boot, Knights said.

Snipers were inside the building where gunman attempted to assassinate Trump

From CNN's Whitney Wild

Snipers were stationed inside the building where a gunman climbed the roof and attempted to assassinate former President Donald Trump, a source familiar with the investigation tells CNN.

The source said the local sniper team hailed from the Butler County Emergency Services Unit.

The team, according to the source, was located on the second floor providing overwatch of the crowd at the rally.

This story continues to get more bizarre... a sniper team was perched indoors in the same exact building that the shooter was on the roof of.

Everything so far is pointing toward this being an apolitical mass shooting. Trump just so happened to be a high profile target that gathered a bunch of other people for this guy to shoot at. He went after him to make a name for himself.

If the guy was willing to go on a shooting spree and likely get killed afterwards, then he probably stopped caring about politics (or anything, really) and therefore wouldn't care about shooting at someone he'd be politically aligned with.

If the guy was willing to go on a shooting spree and likely get killed afterwards, then he probably stopped caring about politics (or anything, really) and therefore wouldn't care about shooting at someone he'd be politically aligned with.

I guess this is what makes more sense with the info we have. A guy that broke inside and instead of a mass shooting he went for a public figure.

After Trump shooting, his supporters still fiercely oppose gun reforms

Their presidential candidate had just narrowly escaped an assassination attempt, a bullet grazing his ear on Saturday from an AR-15-style semiautomatic weapon - a rifle frequently used by mass shooters in the United States.

Yet in interviews with 12 Donald Trump delegates at his Republican Party nominating convention in Milwaukee, none advocated for limits or bans on assault rifles, raising the legal age to buy a gun, or even more robust background checks.

Most viewed even mild measures, such as expanded background checks, or raising the legal age to buy an assault weapon to 21, as infringements on the U.S. Constitution's Second Amendment, which grants citizens the right to own guns.

Steve Kramer, from Georgia, said it was a "lie" that expanded background checks would help.

"If you look at most of the killings, someone stole the gun, so background checks wouldn't matter," Kramer said.

Between 1966 and 2019, apart from school shooters who mainly stole their weapons from family members, most people who committed mass shooting had bought their weapons legally, according to data compiled by the National Institute of Justice, a research agency of the Department of Justice.

(Anti-Christ National Trans, Illegals, & Females Alliance) wireless network to the inner ear cartilage of Thomas Matthew Crook(ed Hillary)s. Off-topic a bit, but it's somewhat alarming how quickly the FBI got into the shooter's phone. Two days and they were able to brute force their way into it. Not entirely surprising, I suppose, and I'd be willing to bet that if polled most people would be happy with that and say it was necessary, but just another reminder that our devices aren't nearly as secure as we sometimes like to think.
